channel.title: Advancing in Java

item.title: Advancing in Java
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

[quote=“iwasinmoparseas101class, post:34, topic:3372”]Yeah that Lesson 1 was a tricky one for me I use a book called Absolute Java which actually quite well written and has a couple of the class methods and stuff in it. Pwnd also gave you a GREAT site reference which is extremely helpful when doing simple and advanced things. Here’s the 1.5.0 documentation:

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/index.html

Good luck with future programming. PM me if you want some simple to tricky projects.[/quote]

omg, thanks man your ownage!

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:36, topic:3372”][quote author=iwasinmoparseas101class link=topic=3980.msg50710#msg50710 date=1150734710]
Yeah that Lesson 1 was a tricky one for me I use a book called Absolute Java which actually quite well written and has a couple of the class methods and stuff in it. Pwnd also gave you a GREAT site reference which is extremely helpful when doing simple and advanced things. Here’s the 1.5.0 documentation:

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/index.html

Good luck with future programming. PM me if you want some simple to tricky projects.
[/quote]

I took that same class, and I even have a backup of that whole book I can upload… If I can find it :)[/quote]
That’d be great, at the moment I’m needing all the data I can get.

Read full topic

item.title: Advancing in Java
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Erm… why would you force yourself to use a text editor, just so you can “learn to code without an IDE”. The IDE will always be there, why make it hard on yourself? You’re not a better programmer if you have the entirety of the API memorised or “only use the HTML docs to look up methods”.

Read full topic

item.title: Advancing in Java
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

Pwnd:

Notepad will make you not want to code xD

rofl, I just use textpad at the moment.

[quote=“Galook, post:28, topic:3372”]I recommend BlueJ

It is what I started learning with. It is very good at teaching object-oriented programming(especially if you read the book). Well, it doesnt auto-complete, it auto indents, and it auto-colors some text to make it look nice. It is very slow compared to some other IDEs, but it is ok if you are just starting[/quote]

rofl, textpad does the same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Advancing in Java
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

Pwnd I’ve been using notepad for…very long? when I started java. Then I learned what I need to import and where I need a bracker and stuff like that from errors and google…then I was pretty good…

I got Eclipse…it made everything MUCH easier but I still know hwo to do everything.

I could make my own Gui’s for months before I even found out Gui editors exist.

Read full topic

item.title: Advancing in Java
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

I recommend BlueJ

It is what I started learning with. It is very good at teaching object-oriented programming(especially if you read the book). Well, it doesnt auto-complete, it auto indents, and it auto-colors some text to make it look nice. It is very slow compared to some other IDEs, but it is ok if you are just starting

Read full topic

item.title: Advancing in Java
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:

Notepad will make you not want to code xD

item.title: Advancing in Java
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

True. What I recommend is at first using notepad. Then once youre not bad, go to Eclipse. After you learn and make a couple of youre own gui’s get a gui builder.

Read full topic

item.title: Advancing in Java
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

Fasga:

I would SERIOUSLY not recommend using any auto-complete IDE’s or anything like that while you are learning. You NEED to memorize these things. Using an IDE to cheat won’t help you learn. Use the Java API as Pwnd said.

But if I were to use it a lot, then wouldn’t I just in time memorize them anyways?

Read full topic

That’s every single method, interface, class, ect. in the Java API.

item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:

Thanks for support

[quote=“Pwnd, post:10, topic:3372”]Oh, lmao. He did have all of them for free some time ago

It might be beneficial for you to up load the videos for this young man, then.[/quote]
